intro: Oldenlandia elatinoides, commonly known as the glassy bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or yellow. The plant has a unique growth habit, often growing in wet or marshy environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and may appear translucent, contributing to its common name. It is part of the family Malvaceae and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in moist conditions.
